name.description: The name of the auto scaling group. By default generated by Terraform.

name_prefix.description: Creates a unique name beginning with the specified

max_size.description: The maximum size of the auto scale group.

min_size.description: The minimum size of the auto scale group.

availability_zones.description: A list of one or more availability zones for the group. This parameter should not be specified when using `vpc_zone_identifier`.

default_cooldown.description: The amount of time, in seconds, after a scaling activity completes before another scaling activity can start.

launch_configuration.description: The name of the launch configuration to use.

launch_template.description: Nested argument with Launch template specification to use to launch instances. Defined below.

mixed_instances_policy.description: Configuration block containing settings to define launch targets for Auto Scaling groups. Defined below.

health_check_type.description: "EC2" or "ELB". Controls how health checking is done.

desired_capacity.description: The number of Amazon EC2 instances that

force_delete.description: Allows deleting the autoscaling group without waiting

load_balancers.description: A list of elastic load balancer names to add to the autoscaling

vpc_zone_identifier.description: A list of subnet IDs to launch resources in.

target_group_arns.description: A list of `aws_alb_target_group` ARNs, for use with Application or Network Load Balancing.

termination_policies.description: A list of policies to decide how the instances in the auto scale group should be terminated. The allowed values are `OldestInstance`, `NewestInstance`, `OldestLaunchConfiguration`, `ClosestToNextInstanceHour`, `OldestLaunchTemplate`, `AllocationStrategy`, `Default`.

suspended_processes.description: A list of processes to suspend for the AutoScaling Group. The allowed values are `Launch`, `Terminate`, `HealthCheck`, `ReplaceUnhealthy`, `AZRebalance`, `AlarmNotification`, `ScheduledActions`, `AddToLoadBalancer`.

tag.description: A list of tag blocks. Tags documented below.

tags.description: A list of tag blocks (maps). Tags documented below.

placement_group.description: The name of the placement group into which you'll launch your instances, if any.

metrics_granularity.description: The granularity to associate with the metrics to collect. The only valid value is `1Minute`. Default is `1Minute`.

enabled_metrics.description: A list of metrics to collect. The allowed values are `GroupDesiredCapacity`, `GroupInServiceCapacity`, `GroupPendingCapacity`, `GroupMinSize`, `GroupMaxSize`, `GroupInServiceInstances`, `GroupPendingInstances`, `GroupStandbyInstances`, `GroupStandbyCapacity`, `GroupTerminatingCapacity`, `GroupTerminatingInstances`, `GroupTotalCapacity`, `GroupTotalInstances`.

min_elb_capacity.description: Setting this causes Terraform to wait for

wait_for_elb_capacity.description: Setting this will cause Terraform to wait

service_linked_role_arn.description: The ARN of the service-linked role that the ASG will use to call other AWS services

max_instance_lifetime.description: The maximum amount of time, in seconds, that an instance can be in service, values must be either equal to 0 or between 604800 and 31536000 seconds.

arn.description: The ARN for this AutoScaling Group

availability_zones.description: The availability zones of the autoscale group.

min_size.description: The minimum size of the autoscale group

max_size.description: The maximum size of the autoscale group

default_cooldown.description: Time between a scaling activity and the succeeding scaling activity.

name.description: The name of the autoscale group

health_check_grace_period.description: Time after instance comes into service before checking health.

health_check_type.description: "EC2" or "ELB". Controls how health checking is done.
